content.raw: I think we should update the bullet points in the "Explicit vs. Implicit frames" section, since it talks about referring to implicit frames as well
content.html: I think we should update the bullet points in the "Explicit vs. Implicit frames" section, since it talks about referring to implicit frames as well

update.description:

‌
update.title: Suggest removal of implicit "world" link

content.raw: @{eacousineau} will you update this PR accordingly?
content.html: @Eric Cousineau will you update this PR accordingly?

content.raw: Per f2f, ya, just gonna keep `world`, not `__world__`.
content.html: Per f2f, ya, just gonna keep world, not __world__.

content.raw: Hm… Given this, I would almost prefer that we ditch `__world__`, and only use `world`… \(Much less work, even if less ideal\)
content.html: Hm… Given this, I would almost prefer that we ditch __world__, and only use world… (Much less work, even if less ideal)

content.raw:
I'm not sure that this is a worthwhile change

but if we do decide to make this change; I would tick-tock by accepting either `world` or `__world__` in `//joint/parent` in 1.7 and only accepting `__world__` in 1.8
content.html:
I'm not sure that this is a worthwhile change

but if we do decide to make this change; I would tick-tock by accepting either world or __world__ in //joint/parent in 1.7 and only accepting __world__ in 1.8

content.raw:
Preview: [http://sdformat.org/tutorials?branch=pose\_frame\_semantics\_proposal-one\_world\_plz&tut=pose\_frame\_semantics\_proposal&cat=pose\_semantics\_docs#removal-of-implicit-world-link-name](http://sdformat.org/tutorials?branch=pose_frame_semantics_proposal-one_world_plz&tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs#removal-of-implicit-world-link-name)

‌

My major concern is how this may adversely affect downstream applications; while I agree it’d be more consistent, it seems like it might introduce a bit of churn…
